wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Gooch (1750 – 1802) was an English artist who also specialised in painting animals, particularly dog and horse portraiture. No portraits of the artist survive.

response: Sir Thomas Gooch, 2nd Baronet (1674–1754) was an English bishop.
Thomas Gooch may also refer to:
*Sir Thomas Gooch, 3rd Baronet (c. 1721–1781), of the Gooch baronets
*Sir Thomas Gooch, 4th Baronet (1745–1826), of the Gooch baronets
*Sir Thomas Gooch, 5th Baronet (1767–1851), of the Gooch baronets, MP for Suffolk

link_mentions.page: List of artists in the Web Gallery of Art (A–K)
response: *Thomas Gooch (1750–1802), 2 paintings : Welsh Springer Spaniel, Private collection (url)
* Colonel George Pitt, First Lord Rivers painted by Thomas Gainsborough circa 1768; and then by Thomas Beach circa 1780 and Thomas Gooch circa 1782
